group_1.textLeft: *Sigh* This is such an irritating problem.

group_1.textRight: I agree. On one hand, it's good there's@been no trouble caused by Witches, but...

group_1.narration: One year before Iroha arrived,@order in Kamihama City was@maintained by three Magical Girls.
The first girl was in charge of@all Magical Girls who lived in the@Daito and Kosho wards in the east.
Kanagi Izumi.

group_1.textRight: Kanagi...

group_1.textLeft: You're badly hurt... [chara:101601:lipSynch_0][wait:0.8][chara:101601:cheek_0][chara:101601:face_mtn_ex_020.exp.json:motion_200][chara:101601:lipSynch_1]Did someone from the@west do this to you?

group_1.textRight: No, it wasn't them.
I'm sorry to say it was a fight between@eastern girls.
A neighboring team tried to hunt a Witch@that appeared in our territory...
And it turned into a fight. Could you help@mediate for us?

group_1.textLeft: All right then, let me help you.

group_1.textRight: Thank you very much!

group_1.narration: The second girl was in charge of all@Magical Girls who lived in the Mizuna,@Sankyo, Shinsei, and Sakae wards@in the west.
Yachiyo Nanami.

group_1.textRight: A-are you sure?!

group_1.textLeft: Yes, our team has enough Grief Seeds.

group_1.textRight: Yes... I was thinking whether or not I should@go all the way to Chuo Ward.

group_1.textLeft: You can hunt a Witch in our territory today.

group_1.textRight: Thank you very much!

group_1.narration: And the final girl...@She was also a leader of the west.
Mifuyu Azusa.

group_1.textRight: I go to school in Minagi, but I'm a@Magical Girl from Chuo Ward.

group_1.narration: ― Hinano ―@I see more Magical Girls from the@east and west in our territory lately.
― Hinano ―@With the situation being what it is, the@Magical Girls in Chuo Ward are wary.

group_1.textRight: I would appreciate it if you reined the@others in.

group_1.textLeft: We'll also continue to keep our agreement@with the east...
And respect the territory of the Magical@Girls in Chuo Ward.
We won't be breaking that pact anytime soon.

group_1.textRight: I'll take your word for it then.

group_1.narration: The goal of the agreement between east and@west was to help each other in tough battles.
In addition to that, if Witch numbers@were low, we let each other fight@Witches outside of our own territory@whenever we ran out of Grief Seeds.
This helped avoid unnecessary conflict@between Magical Girls in both territories.
However, since the number of Witches@in Kamihama started dropping it became@impossible to maintain these rules.@The banked competition between both@regions was flaring back to life.

group_1.textRight: There is also the issue of Chuo Ward.

group_1.textLeft: I understand how you feel. I'd like to draw@Chuo Ward over to our side as well.
After all, the more territory we possess,@the more Grief Seeds we have access to.

group_1.textRight: However...

group_1.narration: "[textRed:Chuo Ward belongs to neither east or west,@only to the Magical Girls living there]."

group_1.textRight: The agreement must be honored.

group_1.textLeft: But I feel like something needs to be done@while there's still trust between us.

group_1.narration: During this time,@Chuo Ward didn't belong@to the east or the west.
It was right on the border@between the two sides,@so it was designated a neutral zone.
The territory was promised to@the Magical Girls living there as@it belonged to neither side.
However...
Due to the shortage in Witches, it@became more difficult to obtain Grief Seeds.@The first place Magical Girls from@both east and west turned their@gaze to was Chuo Ward.

group_1.textLeft: Thank you very much for helping me.

group_1.textRight: No problem at all! Helping each other out is@important.
Oh, yeah! Can I come here again?
I was happy we got to fight together, so I@was hoping we could do it again.

group_1.narration: Some tried to win over Magical Girls@in Chuo Ward and work together@in order to procure more Grief Seeds.

group_1.textRight: What?! Someone as weak as you has no right@to claim any territory!
Come on, how many times do I have to say@this?
This territory doesn't belong to anyone, so@I'm not violating any agreement.

group_1.textLeft: Y-you're a terrible person! This has always@been my territory!

group_1.textRight: Can you stop whining already?! Get out of@here!

group_1.narration: Others chased the weaker Chuo Ward@Magical Girls off of their own territory,@and took all the Grief Seeds for themselves.
Magical Girls started to interfere with@the neutral zone in a number of ways@when the leaders weren't looking.

group_1.textLeft: I haven't heard about any conflicts between@us and the east.

group_1.textRight: It may just be a matter of time.

group_1.textLeft: There are vacant zones that aren't part of@the Chuo Ward Magical Girls' territory.
I asked Momoko and the others to check@their current status.

group_1.textRight: There's a high likelihood that Magical Girls@from the east will try to lay claim to them.

group_1.textLeft: Yes, we must try and come to an agreement@before it's too late.

group_1.textRight: I agree. As fellow Magical Girls, we should@be helping one another.

group_1.textLeft: Even if we all get along individually, when@it comes to the two sides getting along...

group_1.textRight: Oh, should we reach out to Kanagi?
Since this is a territorial issue, it makes@sense to consult the leader of the east.
Also, she has her quirks, but I think she's@a trustworthy person.
Is it possible that you're still holding a@grudge over the last time you saw her?
*Giggle* You hold grudges about the strangest@things, Yachan.
Yachiyo! Mifuyu!

group_1.textLeft: You're hurt! What in the world happened?!
Never mind, sit first. I'll get you some@water.
Mifuyu, please keep an eye on Momoko. We can@talk after.
